text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the English court can allow the tribunal to revoke its injunction under Section 44(6) of the Arbitration Act 1996. The candidate answer discusses Section 44(1) (the court's power to grant interim measures in support of arbitration) but does not mention or discuss Section 44(6), which deals with the court's power to vary or revoke an order made under Section 44(3) (which relates to orders made by the court in support of the tribunal's powers). The candidate answer focuses on the court's power to grant/maintain relief, not the tribunal's power to revoke the court's order under s.44(6).", "criterion_id": "3b951acb-152e-4be0-a915-e1528b4664a3"}
